record.author: Bender et al. (2003a,b)
record.notes: Bender, W.B., Goodenough, W.H., Jackson, F.H., Marck, J.C., Rehg, K.L., Sohn, H., Trussel, S. & Wang, J.W. (2003) Proto-Micronesian Reconstructions I & II.
record.classification: Austronesian, Malayo-Polynesian, Central-Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Eastern Malayo-Polynesian, Oceanic, Central-Eastern Oceanic, Remote Oceanic, Micronesian, Micronesian Proper, Ponapeic-Trukic, Trukic

record.annotation: face, turn or proceed (in a direction). Has directional suffix
carry a load on the shoulder
to chew (as betel nut or sugar cane),
to tear off the husk of coconut or sugarcane with the teeth
set an anchor, tie up a boat
to spear something, stab something, give one an injection
to split or separate (an object) into halves
to squeeze (something) with the hand. Note: metathesis of vowels
dig a hole with a digging implement
open (the way), make room for (more people)
to pound (food) with a mortar and pestle
to fall (as rain or fruit from tree)
be rotten on one side (of fruit)
be rotten on one side (of fruit)
to blow air on (of a person or wind)
wood-burning stove,cooking fire, hibachi, ashes, charcoal, charred wood
light color such as cream, yellow, or tan
